1.content:
The plane arrived at Delfino Plaza, and everyone (all the characters of Super Smash Bros Brawl) soon got off. "How can you stand this heat in that parka?" Ness asked Popo (the Male Ice Climber). The male Ice Climber grinned: "Ness, my friend, I can control ICE. I know how to keep myself cool. See, the ability to control ice allows me and my girlfriend to control our body temperature. Of course, you can't get... dis... tract... ted..." Popo's voice trailed off as he saw Nana (the female Ice Climber) and Paula (Ness's girlfriend) standing nearby, giggling in bikinis. Immediately, the ice crystal that had been forming in his hand melted, and he felt the heat rush back. "Did it suddenly get hot here?!?" he asked, taking off his hood. "C'mon." said Ness, with sly smirk, "Let's go find you some trunks."
Mario, Luigi, and Peach kept looking suspiciously at Bowser, despite his insistence that he would not be having his son use that E.Gadd paintbrush (and, anyway, that contraption hadn't been seen since the events of Super Mario Sunshine).
Pikachu looked around and noticed a strange glow nearby. He hurried over to the glow and found an odd egg.
Kirby was speaking with Chef Kawasaki for dinner. "Now remember: NO spicy curry!" "Extra-spicy curry, got it." "No, NO spicy curry!!!"
And finally, Morton, the NME salesman (not in Brawl) was desperately trying to find a way to increase investments in the company (profits were down in the company after Kirby and his friends masticated the HQ).
1.title: Let's Go!

13122.title: back with kirby

choices: She meets someone else along the way
131231.content:
Samus sat on her beach chair, listening to the sounds of the ocean. It almost seemed unreal – how much of her life was spent on some godforsaken assignment on some inhospitable planet, working – or worse, fighting for her life? Admittedly things had been considerably less stressful during her Smash Brothers time, but it was still work. She honestly wasn’t even sure how to handle herself without some job to do – it had been so long since she’d had a chance to relax in earnest. Maybe even nearly as long ago as the last time she’d had a smoothie.

         Samus looked down at the drink in her hand. Maybe it was weird to be so invested in this, but Samus had always been a weird one. She’d been looking forward to it the whole way over, and as soon as they had gotten everything settled she’d gone looking for a place that sold them. Others had pointed out that she could have gotten one at the airport – on either end – but they didn’t understand. It had to be just right.

         The first time she’d ever had the magical crushed-ice beverage was the summer after her first year at the academy (well, it had been summer on that planet, anyway). That had been such a wonderful, innocent time, before life had decided to try and beat as much happiness out of her as it could. She’d had friends then. Well, OK, that wasn’t really fair to the other Smashers, but that was different. She liked all her fellow Nintendo characters well enough (except for Fox – screw Fox), but she’d always felt like an outsider among them. That summer had been a time when she’d really belonged somewhere. That summer had been a lot of things to her, actually, which is why the smoothie was so important. It represented those days; a last link to a time when she’d been happiest. One sip would bring all that back again, she was certain. Not that she’d told anyone else any of this, of course. As far as they knew, she just really wanted a smoothie.

         And now she had one, in her hand, its straw beckoning her lips like a lover’s kiss (ooh, that was a good one. She should write that down). She tried to recall the taste in her mind, but it was just a faded memory now. A faded memory of a fruity sensation. Samus knew that she’d waited too long already. She brought it up to her face –

         “PIKAAAAA!”

         Samus whipped around to see the small yellow pokemon barreling toward her with a look of panic she’d rarely seen outside of battle. Immediately she tensed up, instincts preparing her for a fight. Something had spooked Pikachu badly, it seemed, and that didn’t bode well for her either. Samus was wondering just what sort of terrible monster might be about to make an appearance when she noticed something else: flames were coming out of Pikachu’s mouth. What on Earth… Perhaps that was the reason for Pikachu’s distress, instead. Something about it did seem familiar… The word ‘curry’ had just crept into her mind when Pikachu was on her. Samus quickly dodged, but not quite quick enough: with a look of desperate, crazed desire, Pikachu snatched the smoothie from her hand. Samus felt the bottom of her stomach fall out as the horrible creature ripped the lid from her precious, cool drink and drained the cup in what seemed to be one foul gulp. For a second, he looked as sick as she felt. Then his cheeks ballooned and he let out a tremendous belch (Samus didn’t even know Pikachus could burp).

         “AAAUUGHHH! You @#$&*, &^*#’#%’’ ^&^@#%@#@ little RAT!” she heard herself say. But it was too late. Pikachu was on his back, groaning, his face an unhealthy color as steam rose from his mouth. Already it was hard to stay mad at the little guy; he really looked sick. Doubtless it had something to do with whatever had lit that fire in his mouth.

         “…Damn it,” Samus muttered to herself. Maybe she couldn’t stay mad at Pikachu, but damned if she couldn’t be mad in general. She had lost her smoothie, the thing she’d been looking forward to for hours, and now she’d have to go all the way back to that little shop and get another one. Well, no sense in waiting, then. After making sure Pikachu was at least not dying, Samus headed back towards the shop where she’d bought her frozen drink (but not before picking up the empty cup, lid, and straw and throwing them all away. Remember, kids: Sakurai says DON’T LITTER). Little did she know what awaited her on her journey…
131231.title: Samus

choices: They arrive at their destination as planned.
1312312.content:
Not halfway up the boardwalk, Samus encountered a familiar figure.

“Meta Knight? What the eff are you doing here?”

While most of the smash crew had jumped at the chance to take a vacation together, a few had declined. The mysterious loner Meta Knight had been one of them. So the little round warrior was one of the last people Samus had expected to see here.

“It was never my intention to imply that I would not be present, only that I would not be traveling with your party”, said Meta Knight. “I saw no reason to take public transportation when I had better means available.”

Samus assumed he was referring to his ship, the Halberd. A few of the others had spaceships; in fact, Samus herself had one that she could summon at any time, but the others had all taken the plane to enjoy the company of their fellow smashers. Although, after the 7-hour flight, Samus could understand why someone might have passed on the plane ride. And where the others’ ships were all fairly small, Meta Knight’s was a huge battleship. Why would anyone take a normal plane when they had that?

“So…where did you park your ship?” Samus asked. “I didn’t see it at the airport.”

“Such things are of no concern to me”, Meta Knight said dismissively. “I merely set it down on a nice patch of land on the island’s other side.”

“I…see.” Samus wondered what the local authorities might say about that. “Does anyone else know you’re here?”

“You are the first I have encountered. But now that I have arrived, I shall make my presence known soon enough!” Meta Knight ended his statement with a dramatic flourish.

There was an awkward pause.

“So…” Meta Knight added at last, “What…what exactly will we be doing? Will there be surfing? I have never surfed. Exactly what does it entail?”

Samus sighed. “You’ve never been on a vacation before, have you?”

“N-not as such, no.”

“Well, I’m going to go get a smoothie. You can come along if you want, but don’t think that means I’ll be paying for both of us.”

Meta Knight thought for a moment. “Hmmm…yes…yes, maybe I shall. I shall have this ‘smoothie’ you speak of. Let us make haste!”

“Well then, follow me.”

The unlikely pair headed down the street together.
1312312.title: She meets someone else along the way

choices: They finally arrive at their destination.
13123122.content:

13123122.title: They meet someone else.

13123123.content:
It was only a few minutes before the smoothie shop came back into view. However, Samus’s ordeal would not be over so quickly. She and her new companion (Meta Knight, in case you somehow forgot between chapters) were greeted by a locked door and a sign reading, ‘CLOSED – Back in a few minutes’.

Samus narrowed her eyes at the use of the words ‘a few’. Those were words that got used when the speaker didn’t want to commit to a specific time period, which only boded ill for her. “A few minutes” could be five or thirty.

Meta Knight seemed unfazed, however. “This is unfortunate, to be sure,” he said, “but only a minor setback. Clearly we need only wait…”

“I don’t want to wait,” said Samus. “I want my smoothie! I’d have one already if… outside circumstances hadn’t intervened once already. I don’t want to have to wait for who knows how long for this place to open up again! I say we find another place.”

“Consider reason, comrade. Can we be certain of the existence of another such shop in this immediate area? And in the time it may take to seek one out, regardless of the fruits of this search, surely this one will have already reopened its doors. I see no benefit in leaving this spot.”


What do they do?
13123123.title: They arrive at their destination as planned.

choices: Back with Samus and Meta Knight
Let's see what someone else is up to.
131231232.content:
“Well, you can stay there if you want. I’m going to look around.” Samus set off down the street – and sure enough, Meta Knight followed. He does know that doesn’t have to come with me, right? she wondered. I’m not complaining, but I’d have thought he’d have better things to do.

From a hilltop just outside of town, unfriendly eyes were watching. This had been years in planning, years of bearing that unforgiveable insult, but now at last the time was at hand. The time…for revenge. The shadowy figure lowered his binoculars and rubbed his hands together with sinister glee.

“Look at them, enjoying themselves”, our unknown antagonist muttered to himself. “So relaxed and carefree… it’s disgusting. These poor saps really have no idea what’s in store for them!” He grinned. “Well, they’d better have fun while they can, because this vacation is about to take a disastrous turn!”

“Everything’s in place, Roy!” shouted Bowser Junior, interrupting his gloating. “Phase one of the Evil Plan is ready to go!”

“Dammit, Junior!” cried an exasperated Roy. “I told you not to use my name! Now my secret identity won’t be a secret anymore! I had a big dramatic reveal planned and everything and you just ruined it, Gawh!”

“Sorry, dude. But really I only ruined it for the readers, you know? The other Nintendo characters still don’t know that you’re here or anything, so you can still reveal it to them.”

“I know”, sulked the rejected Fire Emblem character, “but it’s not the same!”

“Well, anyway, I just wanted to let you know that everything’s all set up and everyone else is ready to go. We’re ready when you are.”

Roy recovered from his moping as quickly as he could. “Fine. Good.” He paused. “I mean, uh… excellent,” he added, rubbing his hands together again in what he hoped was a suitably villainous pose. “This isn’t just for me. This is for everyone they wouldn’t let into Brawl! This is our payback!”

“Piiii!!” Pichu interjected, enthusiastically.

“Tell everyone it’s time to start”, Roy said to Bowser Jr. as they slunk off toward the jungle.

“Will do. Say, did I ever tell you I have a brother named Roy?”

“Yes. You’ve told me almost every single day since we first met.”

“Pichu!”

“Shut up.”
131231232.title: Go looking for another place.

15.content:
Sonic was chillin' by the beach enjoying the rays and letting his speedy little feet realx a bit. "ahhhhh, just a little R&R. Every thing I needed after that little fight with mario the other day." A little off from Sonic, Link and toon Link were deep in conversation.
"how do we exist at the same time? We are generations apart?" Toon link asked.
"I though about that before and I got a headake. Just leave alone for now, k kid? I got something to take car of..."
"Is it about Zelda?"
"... yes."
"When are you gonna teach me about girls. You know, I got Tetra... wait how do they exist at the same time?-"
"Yah know what kid?" Link cut in, "Stop before you brake the forth wall...."

Off in the Ocean, Fox was enjoying the seed boat he rented.
"Just like piloting an Arwing. And this time no peppy hair saying-"
Suddenly Peppy Hair appeared on the boat's screen and said "DO A BARREL ROOL!!!"
"Oh, C'mon!"

Everyone had starred as they wlked by her as she tanned, Sonic slowed down to walk as he went by and she though she saw Popo get slapped by Nana for starring. "I just hope Snake or Captain Falcon sees me soon. THAT would be what wouls make this trip perfect." Samus drank a little of her drink, put her sunglasses over her eyes again, and assumed the position.

1512.title: Cause mischief to every other smash cast member

info.brief_description: The characters of Brawl go on vacation in Delfino Plaza!
info.description: The characters of Super Smash Bros Brawl go on vacation in Delfino Plaza, but NME and its ilk can't resist trying to ruin the fun. Also, a bunch of crazy scenarios and hilarious hijinks result from otherwise ordinary scenarios (Examples: Sonic accidentally convinces Pit, the Ice Climbers, and Diddy Kong that he's a shark [It's the hair], Manaphy goes on a switching spree for grins, and Kirby and Chef Kawasaki inadvertently serve the group Super Spicy Curry). Have fun! And, uh, send me a postcard, would you?
